title: Tiny pacemakers aim to make infant heart surgeries less invasive, while cutting operating costs and time

title_detail.value: Tiny pacemakers aim to make infant heart surgeries less invasive, while cutting operating costs and time

summary: A prototype for a miniature pacemaker, about the size of an almond, aims to make pacemaker procedures for infants less invasive, less painful, and more efficient, measured by shorter surgeries, faster recovery times and reduced medical costs.
